文献ID: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_032_chunk1
证据片段: Transient-heating tube-burst tests were conducted on a $5 0 . 8 – c m$ length of Zircaloy cladding obtained from spent-fuel rods irradiated in the H. B. Robinson power reactor to a peak burn-up of $3 0 \mathrm { \ i M W D / k g }$

文献ID: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_032_chunk1
证据片段: Internal electrical resistance heaters were used to achieve nominal heating rates of $2 8 ^ { \circ } \mathsf { C } / \mathsf { s }$ for the tests

文献ID: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_032_chunk1
证据片段: The tests were conducted in steam

文献ID: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_032_chunk1
证据片段: Tube burst pressures varied from 0.965 to $1 2 . 5 1 4 ~ \mathrm { { \bf ~ M P a } }$

文献ID: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_032_chunk1
证据片段: Failure strains ranged up to $4 6$ percent when burst occurred at upper $( \alpha +$ $\beta ,$ and $\beta$ -phase temperatures and up to 30 percent for failures occurring at lower temperatures

文献ID: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_032_chunk1
证据片段: Failure strains ranged up to $4 6$ percent when burst occurred at upper $( \alpha +$ $\beta ,$ and $\beta$ -phase temperatures and up to 30 percent for failures occurring at lower temperatures

文献ID: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_032_chunk1
证据片段: No significant difference in burst behavior between unirradiated and spent nuclear fuel Zircaloy cladding was observed experimentally

文献ID: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_032_chunk2
证据片段: The inside oxide appeared to be slightly more porous than the outside oxide.

文献ID: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_032_chunk3
证据片段: the angular temperature difference in these tests appears to be of the order of 35 to $4 0 ^ { \circ } \mathbf { C }$

文献ID: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_032_chunk3
STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_032_chunk3
证据片段: complete annealing of irradiation strengthening at temperatures below ${ 7 0 0 ^ { \circ } C }$ during transient heating at rates up to $2 8 ^ { \circ } \mathbf { C } / \mathbf { s }$

文献ID: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_032_chunk3
证据片段: the tensile properties were essentially independent of maximum cladding temperature and cooling rate, but were dependent on the oxygen distribution through the cladding wall

文献ID: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_032_chunk3
证据片段: "the oxygen concentration must be less than 0.7 weight percent over at least half the cladding thickness."

文献ID: STP681-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_4th Volume_032_chunk4
证据片段: Under the conditions postulated for a loss-of-coolant accident (LOCA) the Zircaloy-4 fuel cladding of the CANDU (CANada-Deuterium-Uranium) reactor may experience a temperature transient during which it absorbs an appreciable quantity of oxygen.
